issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
[~hgadre] tried testing solr with a Hadoop 3 client. He saw various test case failures due to what look like functionality gaps in the new aalto-xml stax implementation pulled in by HADOOP-14216:

{noformat}
   [junit4]    > Throwable #1: com.fasterxml.aalto.WFCException: Illegal XML character ('Ã¼' (code 252))
....
   [junit4]    > Caused by: com.fasterxml.aalto.WFCException: General entity reference (&bar;) encountered in entity expanding mode: operation not (yet) implemented
...
   [junit4]    > Throwable #1: org.apache.solr.common.SolrException: General entity reference (&wacky;) encountered in entity expanding mode: operation not (yet) implemented
{noformat}

These were from the following test case executions:

{noformat}
NOTE: reproduce with: ant test  -Dtestcase=DocumentAnalysisRequestHandlerTest -Dtests.method=testCharsetOutsideDocument -Dtests.seed=2F739D88D9C723CA -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=und -Dtests.timezone=Atlantic/Faeroe -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII
NOTE: reproduce with: ant test  -Dtestcase=MBeansHandlerTest -Dtests.method=testXMLDiffWithExternalEntity -Dtests.seed=2F739D88D9C723CA -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=en-US -Dtests.timezone=US/Aleutian -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII
NOTE: reproduce with: ant test  -Dtestcase=XmlUpdateRequestHandlerTest -Dtests.method=testExternalEntities -Dtests.seed=2F739D88D9C723CA -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=hr -Dtests.timezone=America/Barbados -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII
NOTE: reproduce with: ant test  -Dtestcase=XmlUpdateRequestHandlerTest -Dtests.method=testNamedEntity -Dtests.seed=2F739D88D9C723CA -Dtests.slow=true -Dtests.locale=hr -Dtests.timezone=America/Barbados -Dtests.asserts=true -Dtests.file.encoding=US-ASCII
{noformat}
fields.summary: Switch from aalto-xml to woodstox to handle odd XML features

comments.body: [~jeagles] do you mind triaging this? Starting it off as a blocker since I think these same issues affect Hadoop too. If so, aalto-stax might not be ready for primetime.
Looking at https://github.com/FasterXML/aalto-xml/commits/master this library doesn't look like it's under active development. Two commits in 2016 and 2017 combined.
why aren't we just using the StaX parser built into the JVM? Assuming its a DOM/Stax perf issue which was the problem

FWIW solr uses woodstox, it seems to be second fastest after aalto, and more mature:

https://github.com/FasterXML/woodstox
https://stackoverflow.com/a/11782775 (SO answer from author of woodstox and aalto)

[~andrew.wang], while looking into this I was unable to run the tests. SOLR doesn't compile out of the box against branch-2 or trunk builds due to missing hadoop-hdfs-client dependencies. Is there a patch I can use to get solr so I can compile and run against trunk or branch-2.

My first thought would be to migrate the stax parser to woodstox. In fact, I used woodstox as the basis of the patch and made a late switch to alto. I have attached a patch to switch to woodstox. Can you or [~hgadre] please try this patch to see if the above tests are passing? Otherwise, if you could please help me to compile and run solr tests against 2.9.0-SNAPSHOT that would help as well.

This message was automatically generated.

Might be useful to get the errant XML file and see if that can be used as a test. The first error could be that an XML entity is using a char that is allowed in XML1.1 but not 1.0; the second one looks just like it's an entity ref

Thanks for the quick action Jonathan! I was able to successfully run the mentioned solr tests with the patch applied to our internal branches, so I think the change is good.

I like [~stevel@apache.org]'s idea about test coverage. I poked in the Solr codebase a bit, and the failing unit tests are self-contained so we can probably adapt them easily enough for Hadoop:

https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/solr/core/src/test/org/apache/solr/handler/DocumentAnalysisRequestHandlerTest.java#L173
https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/solr/core/src/test/org/apache/solr/handler/admin/MBeansHandlerTest.java#L86
https://github.com/apache/lucene-solr/blob/master/solr/core/src/test/org/apache/solr/handler/XmlUpdateRequestHandlerTest.java#L139

+1 with this additional testing.

This LGTM +1, thanks for working on this [~jeagles]! Could you also respond to Steve's question why we aren't using the JDK stax implementation? I'm guessing the answer is performance.

[~stevel@apache.org], I also tried the jdk stax implementation and it was much, much slow than either the woodstox or alto xml. https://dzone.com/articles/xml-unmarshalling-benchmark is outdated but the numbers are representative of what I was seeing.
[~andrew.wang], should I go ahead and check this into trunk and branch-2?

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11858 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11858/])
HADOOP-14501. Switch from aalto-xml to woodstox to handle odd XML (jeagles: rev a81916ea89d59c1642b3462e3d7c6c1acb1e7109)
